app-description: Sunrise is the base layer for Interliquid Networks
about-1: We're thrilled to announce our latest public sale of 2025 with Sunrise - The base layer for Interliquid Networks.
about-2: Sunrise integrates Data Availability layer and Liquidity Hub functions into a single platform powered by Proof-of-Liquidity — enabling sovereign rollups and leading L1s like Ethereum and Solana to connect seamlessly through deep, shared liquidity.
answer-1: Reduces liquidity fragmentation across sovereign rollups and major L1s like Ethereum and Solana.
answer-2: First L1 DA layer with native DA Fee Abstraction — pay gas in any token via on-chain swaps.
answer-3: Scalable off-chain blobspace — handles multi-MB payloads in < 15 s, enabling data-intensive apps like AI pipelines, real-time gaming, and on-chain analytics without bloating the chain.
answer-4: Sunrise introduces Extended Proof of Liquidity which enables Sunrise to participate in a mutually beneficial relationship with Berachain’s liquidity environment by extending Berachain’s PoL to the L2 level

fundamentals.title: Fundamentals
fundamentals.description: Sunrise integrates modular Data Availability layer and Liquidity Hub functions that remodels how developers build and scale applications. By leveraging our unique Proof of Liquidity model and Fee Abstraction capabilities, you can create secure, liquid, and cost-effective rollups and Layer 2 solutions to interact through deep, shared liquidity.

step-3.label: ULTRA APPLICATIONS
step-3.description: Built to support fully onchain AI and Gaming.

level-1: Liquidity Hub powered by Proof of Liquidity
level-1-desc: Sunrise is a liquidity hub that uses the PoL consensus model to deepen both security and liquidity for L2 rollups. Sunrise’s DEX and cross-chain infrastructure let the rollup tap into a single, high-throughput marketplace for liquidity. The benefits for rollups include reducing liquidity fragmentation and increasing liquidity for the rollup’s native token.
level-2-desc-1: Sunrise introduces Fee Abstraction: now any transaction, including DA blob publishes—can be paid in the token you already hold. Behind the scenes, Sunrise swaps a small fraction into $RISE to cover gas, so your project’s own token works as the gas coin from day one.
level-2-desc-2: By providing assets as liquidity in Sunrise’s pools, liquidity providers align their success with the DA network’s overall health, thus driving a more collaborative ecosystem.
level-3-desc: Sunrise provides high-throughput data availability, offering enhanced scalability and flexibility for applications even such as gaming. Utilizing decentralized storage solutions such as IPFS and Arweave, data shards are stored externally.
key-feature-1: OFF-CHAIN ERASURE ENCODING: Blobs are encoded off-chain; validators store only the Merkle root on-chain, cutting storage and compute overhead.
key-feature-2: OFF-CHAIN BLOB PROPAGATION: Transactions carry only metadata; full payloads travel over a P2P blob network, enabling sub-15-second data availability and a lightweight mempool.
key-feature-3: KZG COMMITMENT: A single on-chain KZG commitment secures each blob, allowing rapid integrity checks and availability challenges
comparision-title: Comparison Between On-Chain DA Attestation & Off-Chain DA Attestation
level-4-desc: The protocol generates revenue through three channels.
revenue-2: Swap fees in the liquidity pool
closer-title: A closer look into the DA space...
sales-details-desc: We can change from 6-10% by adjusting community allocation 2% distribution.

note-locked:
Note: locked tokens may be staked.
RISE tokens received from staking are unlocked
dual-token-system-1: $vRISE: Non-Transferable token for staking and governance
dual-token-system-1-desc-1: Cannot be bought. It is exclusively earned by providing liquidity to pools on Sunrise.
dual-token-system-1-desc-2: Can be staked to earn RISE staking rewards.
dual-token-system-1-desc-3: Grants governance rights, including participation in gauge voting.
dual-token-system-1-desc-4: Can be burned 1:1 to receive RISE.
dual-token-system-2-desc-2: All fee abstracted transactions get auto-swapped to RISE under the hood.
dual-token-system-2-desc-3: Can be staked to earn rewards.
dual-token-system-2-desc-4: Backed by a capped supply and no infinite inflation.
dual-token-system-2-desc-5: 50% of all RISE used in tx fees is burned.
dual-token-system-2-desc-6: Liquidity pools on Sunrise use RISE as the base asset, especially those eligible for bribes.
token-description: $RISE token is the native token of Sunrise Network
token-usecase-1-desc: RISE is used to pay transaction fees on Sunrise, with a portion of each fee burned to reduce circulating supply and introduce deflationary pressure. This burn is based on a percentage of gas costs and supports Sunrise’s sustainable design and efficient fee management. At the same time, Proof of Liquidity (PoL) drives continuous demand for RISE by using it to secure deep, active liquidity across the Sunrise ecosystem.
token-usecase-2-desc: $vRISE can be staked to the Sunrise network. The staked amount will be calculated as a voting power for the governance. Furthermore, the rewards for stakers will be distributed in proportion to the staked amount.
token-usecase-3-desc-1: Through vRISE gauge voting, liquidity incentives are allocated to the pools and rollups that drive real usage. Each gauge represents a product, like a liquidity pool and vRISE holders vote to decide how newly issued vRISE is distributed across these gauges.
token-usecase-3-desc-2: The more voting power a gauge collects, the more vRISE it receives, aligning rewards with active ecosystems and reinforcing long-term liquidity growth.

join-sunrise-desc: Be part of the next generation of blockchain infratructure
glosarry-1: DA Layer: A Data Availability (DA) layer ensures all transaction data is accessible and verifiable, so chains or rollups can focus on execution without storing everything on-chain. Think of it as the storage backbone that guarantees data can be checked by anyone.
glosarry-2: Blob / Blobspace: “Blobs” are large chunks of data handled separately from typical on-chain transactions to reduce congestion. “Blobspace” is the dedicated capacity for these data chunks, allowing for bigger, more flexible data storage.
glosarry-3: Liquidity Fragmentation: When crypto assets are split across multiple platforms, access to large, unified liquidity pools becomes difficult, increasing trading costs and complexity.
glosarry-4: Proof of Liquidity (PoL): Proof of Liquidity (PoL) is a novel consensus mechanism that strengthens a chain’s security by requiring participants to provide on-chain liquidity.
glosarry-5: Fee Abstraction: The ability to pay for network services (like storing data) with multiple kinds of assets, rather than one specific token. It simplifies costs by letting participants contribute liquidity in whatever form suits them best.
glosarry-6: Rollup/L2: A second-layer protocol built on top of a main blockchain to handle more transactions at lower costs. Rollups batch or execute transactions off the main chain while still relying on it for security or final settlement. Optimism and Arbitrum are well known examples.
